item.value: skip headers that do not have an `id` attribute
add custom class(es) for each anchor element
add a base url to the TOC links for when your TOC is on another page than the actual content
add custom class(es) for each child group of headings; has support for '%level%' placeholder which is the current "submenu" heading level
add custom class(es) for each list item; has support for '%level%' placeholder, which is the current heading level
when set to true, an ordered list will be outputted instead of an unordered list
the maximum TOC header level to use; any header greater than this value will be ignored
the minimum TOC header level to use; any header lower than this value will be ignored
when set to true, the headers will be stripped of any HTML in the TOC
